title: Tech and Friends - Episode 437: Shawn Wildermuth on the "Hello World" Road Trip
description: I'm interviewed by David Giard about the Road Trip!

title: Creating the Smallest ASP.NET Core RC2 App
description: This short tutorial shows you how to convert a new console app to a web server to see how the pieces fit together with the upcoming RC2.

title: Visual Studio Tips: Refactoring and Building Classes
description: In this video, I show you how to build classes and types with Visual Studio's built-in refactoring support.

title: Docker and ASP.NET Core
description: Some learnings from my fun with hosting ASP.NET Core in a Docker container, both on a local machine and in Azure.

title: Visual Studio Tips: Shortcut Keys
description: I get asked a lot about what keys I tap during my courses, so I thought I'd put together some of my favorite trips with shortcut keys in Visual Studio.

title: Angular 2 and ASP.NET Core Projects
description: Originally a webcast where I build an Angular 2 project in a ASP.NET Project live, it's not without some bumps and bruises but hopefully there are some things to learn here.

title: Using Bower in ASP.NET Core and Visual Studio 2015
description: A video where I show how to use Bower to do your ASP.NET 5 (ASP.NET Core) projects.

title: Learn about ASP.NET 5 with expert Shawn Wildermuth
description: In this Pluralsight webcast, I show you how to build an ASP.NET Core (e.g. ASP.NET 5) project from scratch!

title: Bootstrap 3 grid system explained
description: In this preview of my Pluralsight Bootstrap 3 course, I show how the grid system works.

title: Piggybacking on ASP.NET authentication with Web API
description: In this preview of Preview of my Pluralsight ASP.NET Web API course, I show how to use cookie authentication to secure your REST APIs.

title: Making scalable JavaScript
description: In thie preview of my Pluralsight Course on Large Scale JavaScript, I talk about how scalability in JavaScript.

title: Building the Wireframe in Visual Studio with Zen Coding
description: In this preview from my Pluralsight course on ASP.NET 4 (end-to-end), I show Zen Coding in Visual Studio.

title: Designing Web API URIs
description: In this preview of my Pluralsight course on Designing APIs, I talk about starting a Web API by designing the URLs.

title: How to build AngularJS directives using Webstorm 9
description: In this preview of my Webstorm 9 course for Pluralsight, I show how to build directives directly in Webstorm.

title: Why Testing DOM-Centric JavaScript is Hard
description: In this free clip from Large Scale JavaScript for Client and Server, I show you why testing your DOM-Centric JavaScript is difficult.

title: Scoping in JavaScript Functions
description: In this excerpt from my "JavaScript for C# Developers", I show you how scoping in JavaScript is different from C# so you don't make the same mistakes he did when he first was dabbling in the language.

title: Namespace Simulation Using C# in JavaScript
description: Too many globally scoped variables and functions can make Javascript code difficult to work with, particularly on large projects. In this video excerpt fromm course JavaScript for C# Developers you'll see how to simulate the concept of namespaces using objects.

title: Refactoring CSS Rules to LESS
description: In this demo from his A Better CSS: LESS and SASS course, I show you how to take nested CSS Rules and refactoring them using LESS into more maintainable code.

title: CSS Debugging Tips
description: Getting your web applications styled just right can sometimes require a bit of iteration. In this video excerpt from my course "Debugging the Web" you'll see how to edit the CSS rules in the browser where you can see the affects immediately and then how to move those changes back to your source stylesheet.

title: What's new with WebStorm 9
description: In this webinar, I will walk through the new features in WebStorm 9, a full web IDE from JetBrains.

title: Modifying Styles with Firebug
description: In this course excerpt from Debugging the Web, I show you how you can change styling information using Firebug and see the results in real-time.

title: What is Bootstrap 4
description: From NDC London 2016: After a couple of years in the planning, Bootstrap 4 is finally coming. If you’re already using Bootstrap or if you want a responsive framework to start building websites, this talk will introduce you to the newest version of this popular framework.

title: aspConf 2012: Modern Web Development
description: In this talk, Shawn will walk the attendees through the new way that web applications are being built today using the latest in client-side development the best practices of how to carry that out with ASP.NET MVC.

title: aspConf 2012: Responsive Design
description: Instead of creating separate sites for the different sized mobile experiences, you should be creating sites that adapt to the screen they're shown on. In this talk, Shawn Wildermuth will show you the basics of making CSS work for you with responsive design techniques.
